ml:doc-envelope.ml:original-txt:
ï»¿OFFICIAL DOCUMENTS) Administration Agreement between the Ministry of Strategy and Finance of the Republic of Korea and International Bank for Reconstruction and Development International Development Association concerning the World Bank Group Korea Office Trust Fund (No. 072263). 1. The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ("IBRD") and the International Development Association ("IDA"), (collectively, the "World Bank") acknowledge that the Ministry of Strategy and Finance of the Republic of Korea (the "Donor", and together with the World Bank, the "Parties" and each a "Party") agrees to provide the sum of six million seven hundred and five thousand United States Dollars (USD 6,705,000) (the "Contribution") for the World Bank Group Korea Office Single-Donor Trust Fund, No. 072263 (the "Trust Fund") in accordance with the terms of this Administration Agreement. 2. The Contribution shall be used to finance the activities set forth in the "World Bank Group Korea Office Trust Fund Description" attached hereto as Annex 1, and shall be administered by the World Bank on behalf of the Donor in accordance with the terms of this Administration Agreement, including the "Standard Provisions" attached hereto as Annex 2 and "Governance" attached hereto as Annex 3. 3. The Donor hereby authorizes the World Bank to transfer the Contribution in accordance with the following schedule and in the currency specified in Section 1 above ("Contribution Currency") from the Korea-World Bank Group Partnership Facility Pre-Paid Trust Fund (TF No. 072055) into the Trust Fund (TF No. 072263) (each such transfer hereinafter referred to as an "Installment"): (A) Promptly following countersignature USD 2,235,000; (B) By June 30, 2015 USD 2,235,000; (C) By June 30, 2016 USD 2,235,000. 4. Any notice, request or other communication to be given or made under this Administration Agreement shall be in writing and delivered by mail, fax or e-mail to the respective Party's address specified below or at such other address as such Party notifies in writing to the other Party from time to time: For the World Bank (the "Bank Contact"): Mme. Joyce Msuya Special Representative, Korea The World Bank POSCO E&C TOWER BUILDING, 370 Floor Incheon Tower Daero 241 Yeonsu-gu, Incheon, 406-732 Republic of Korea E-mail: jmsuya@worldbank.org For the Donor (the "Donor Contact"): Mr. Seongman Byun Deputy Director International Financial Institutions Division Ministry of Strategy and Finance 1
ï»¿Government Complex, Sejong 339-012 Republic of Korea Tel: (82-44) 215-4832 Fax: (82-44) 215-8139 E-mail: stman621@korea.kr 5. In the event any amounts are to be returned to the Donor under this Administration Agreement, the World Bank shall transfer such amounts to the Korea-World Bank Group Partnership Facility Pre-Paid Trust Fund (TF No. 072055), unless otherwise agreed with the World Bank. 6. All annexes hereto constitute an integral part of this Administration Agreement, whose terms taken together shall constitute the entire agreement and understanding between the Donor and the World Bank. Unless otherwise specified in an annex hereto, this Administration Agreement may be amended only by written amendment between the World Bank and the Donor. 7. Each of the Parties represents, by confirming its agreement below, that it is authorized to enter into this Administration Agreement and act in accordance with these terms and conditions. The Parties are requested to sign and date this Administration Agreement, and upon possession by the World Bank of this fully signed Administration Agreement, this Administration Agreement shall become effective as of the date of the last signature. INTERNATIONAL BANK FOR RECONSTRUCTION AND DEVELOPMENT INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT ASSOCIATION By:___ Name: Klaus Rohland Title: Country Director Date: 247 2 MINISTRY OF STRATEGY AND FINANCE OF THE REPUBLIC OF KOREA By: :_ _ _ _ Name: Hohvun, Jang Title: Deputy Director General for International Finance Bureau Date: J LA. , /L. 2
ï»¿ANNEX 1 World Bank Group Korea Office Trust Fund Description This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of the Administration Agreement for the Trust Fund between the World Bank and the Donor. 1. Objectives The objective of the Trust Fund is to deepen the partnership between the Korean government, Korean stakeholders and the World Bank Group. Specifically, the Trust Fund aims at: (a) supporting the coordination between the World Bank and the Donor, facilitating communications, dialogue and engagement on development issues; (b) enabling strategic cooperation between the World Bank and Korean development partners; (c) supporting the expansion of knowledge and awareness of Korean stakeholders and the public at large, on joint development cooperation between the Donor, the World Bank and Korean development partners; (d) improving aid effectiveness and promoting transaction efficiencies by facilitating closer working relations at the country level; and (e) assisting the Donor in transferring and disseminating its unique development experience and economic model to other developing countries, with a view to foster poverty alleviation and growth. 2. Activities The activities (which may be described as "components" of activities) to be financed by the Trust Fund are Bank-executed activities, for which the Bank has implementation responsibility: (a) Supporting the World Bank Group Korea Office to serve as the focal point for relations between the World Bank and Korean development partners, including government institutions, private sector, academics and civil society. This support will be aimed at, inter alia: (i) coordinating the work programs of the different units of the World Bank in Korea; and (ii) the development of a strategic communications program, including the dissemination of Korea-World Bank partnership activities and the promotion of high-level dialogue on development, knowledge exchange and innovation. (b) Supporting the International Finance Corporation's ("IFC") strategic priorities in Korea, namely: (i) the strengthening of partnerships with Korean enterprises and financial institutions as they pursue investment opportunities in emerging markets; (ii) advancing further mobilization of financial resources and strengthening IFC's relationship with key Korean financial institutions; and (iii) deepening the partnership between the Donor and IFC Advisory Services, with the goal of supporting the Donor's key priorities in areas such as the Green Growth and the G20 SME Finance Agendas. (c) Supporting the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency's ("MIGA") work program in Korea, including extending outreach efforts targeting public and private sector stakeholders, as well as reinforcing MIGA's market presence in the country and exploring potential partnerships with the Donor in order to develop infrastructure financing facilities that count with MIGA guarantees and support. (d) Provision of financial support to cover staffing costs of internationally and locally recruited staff to be stationed in the World Bank Group Korea Office, as agreed between the Donor and the Bank. An indicative description of personnel, showing the title and unit assignments is set forth below. The Parties 3
ï»¿hereby acknowledge that the World Bank may, in its sole discretion, adjust such list from time to time pursuant to the requirements of the work program: ECR/EAP: 1 Special Representative (IRS), 1 Program Manager (LRS), 1 Liaison Officer (LRS), 1 Executive Assistant (LRS), 1 ACS (LRS) to support office staff, 1 Communications Officer (LRS) WBI: 1 Program Coordinator (IRS), 1 Operations Officer (LRS) IFC: 1 Representative (IRS), 1 Analyst (LRS) MIGA: 1 Representative (LRS - with the possibility of converting the position to IRS in the future, if the Donor and the World Bank so agree); 1 Analyst (LRS) 3. Eligible Expenditures For Bank-executed activities, the Trust Fund funds may be used to finance: (a) sixty percent (60%) of all IRS and LRS staffing costs (including salaries, benefits, field assignment benefits, with or without indirects, as applicable); (b) one hundred percent (100%) of the employer's contributions of all LRS staffs payment obligations that may be due by any such staff to the Donor, under the Donor's National Health Insurance system; (c) consultant fees for individuals and/or firms; (d) short-term and extended-term consultants and experts (including fees, travel expenses and indirects); (e) temporary support staff costs; (f) media, workshop, conference, meeting and representation costs; (g) travel expenses; (h) contractual services; (i) associated overheads, materials and incidentals; (j) equipment purchase (any equipment to be purchased shall be put at the Donor's disposal upon closure of the Trust Fund, unless otherwise agreed by the Donor and the World Bank) and equipment and office premises lease cost; and (k) any other expenses that may be authorized by the Donor from time to time. Following completion or termination of the implementation of the Activities, any equipment purchased for the Activities will be used or disposed of in accordance with standard World Bank procedures, in agreement with the Donor. 4. Taxes The foregoing activities and categories of expenditures may include the financing of taxes in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures. 4
ï»¿ANNEX 2 Standard Provisions This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of the Administration Agreement for the Trust Fund between the World Bank and the Donor, it being understood that any plural references in the annexes to Donors, Administration Agreements, Contributions and pro rata shares shall be read as singular references to the Donor, its Administration Agreement, its Contributions thereunder and the remaining uncommitted balance of the Trust Fund, respectively. 1. Administration of the Contributions 1.1 The World Bank shall be responsible only for performing those functions specifically set forth in this Administration Agreement and shall not be subject to any other duties or responsibilities to the Donors, including, without limitation, any duties or obligations that might otherwise apply to a fiduciary or trustee under general principles of trust or fiduciary law. Nothing in this Administration Agreement shall be considered a waiver of any privileges or immunities of the World Bank under its Articles of Agreement or any applicable law, all of which are expressly reserved. 1.2 Each Donor's Contribution (collectively, the "Contributions") shall be administered in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures, as the same may be amended from time to time, including its procurement, financial management, disbursement and safeguard policies, its framework to prevent and combat fraud and corruption and its screening procedures to prevent the use of Bank resources to finance terrorist activity, in line with the World Bank's obligations to give effect to the relevant decisions of the Security Council taken under Chapter VII of the of Charter of the United Nations. The Donors acknowledge that this provision does not create any obligations of the World Bank under the anti-terrorist financing and asset control laws, regulations, rules and executive orders of an individual member country that may apply to a Donor. 2. Management of the Contributions 2.1 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund shall be accounted for as a single trust fund and shall be kept separate and apart from the funds of the World Bank. The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be commingled with other trust fund assets maintained by the World Bank. The World Bank, in its capacity as trustee, has legal title to the funds deposited in the Trust Fund. 2.2 The currency in which the funds in the Trust Fund shall be held is United States Dollars (the "Holding Currency"). 2.3 Donors agree to deposit their Contributions in the Contribution Currency stated in their respective Administration Agreements. In the case of deposits received in a Contribution Currency other than the Holding Currency, promptly upon the receipt of such amounts and the accompanying Deposit Instructions, the World Bank shall convert such amounts into the Holding Currency at the exchange rate obtained by the World Bank on the date of the conversion. Where deposits prove to be insufficient to complete activities as a result of exchange rate fluctuations, neither the World Bank nor the Donor shall bear any responsibility for providing any additional financing. 5
ï»¿2.4 The funds deposited in the Trust Fund may be freely exchanged by the World Bank into other currencies as may facilitate their disbursement at the exchange rate obtained by the World Bank on the date of the conversion. 2.5 The World Bank shall invest and reinvest the funds deposited in the Trust Fund pending their disbursement in accordance with the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures for the investment of trust funds administered by the World Bank. The World Bank shall credit all income from such investment to the Trust Fund to be used for the same purposes as the Contributions. 3. Trust Fund Fees and Costs 3.1 The Bank shall deduct and retain for its own account, as a one-time deduction from the funds in the Trust Fund, an amount equal to and not greater than thirty-five thousand United States Dollars (US$35,000) as a set-up fee for the Trust Fund upon receipt of funds in the Trust Fund. 3.2 The World Bank shall additionally deduct and retain for its own account, as a deduction from each Installment, an amount equal to five percent (5%) per Installment as an administrative fee for the Trust Fund. 3.3 Each Donor acknowledges and agrees that the percentage deductions for fees in this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section are estimated on the basis of anticipated Contributions. If actual Contributions significantly differ from what was originally anticipated at the time of signature of the first Administration Agreement, or if other circumstances affecting Trust Fund fees or costs change, the World Bank reserves the right to request a change to the terms of this Trust Fund Fees and Costs section, which would be effectuated by amendments made to the Administration Agreements of all Donors and which would thereafter be applicable to all new Contributions that are provided either as amendments to supplement existing Administration Agreements or from new Donors under new Administration Agreements. 4. Accounting and Financial Reporting 4.1 The World Bank shall maintain separate records and ledger accounts in respect of the funds deposited in the Trust Fund and disbursements made therefrom. 4.2 The World Bank shall furnish to the Donors current financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. Within six (6) months after all commitments and liabilities under the Trust Fund have been satisfied and the Trust Fund has been closed, the final financial information relating to receipts, disbursements and fund balance in the Holding Currency with respect to the Contributions shall be made available to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Funds Donor Center secure website. 4.3 The World Bank shall provide to the Donors via the World Bank's Trust Fund Donor Center secure website, within six (6) months following the end of each Bank fiscal year, an annual single audit report, comprising (i) a management assertion together with an attestation from the World Bank's external auditors concerning the adequacy of internal control over cash-based financial reporting for all cash-based trust funds as a whole; and (ii) a combined financial statement for all cash-based trust funds together with the World Bank's external auditor's opinion thereon. The cost of the single audit shall be borne by the World Bank. 4.4 If a Donor wishes to request, on an exceptional basis, a financial statement audit by the World Bank's external auditors of the Trust Fund, the Donor and the World Bank shall first consult as to whether such an external audit is necessary. The World Bank and the Donor shall agree on the appropriate scope and 6
ï»¿terms of reference of such audit. Following agreement on the scope and terms of reference, the World Bank shall arrange for such external audit. The costs of any such audit, including the internal costs of the World Bank with respect to such audit, shall be bome by the requesting Donor. 5. Progress Reporting 5.1 The World Bank shall provide the Donors with annual reports on the progress of activities financed by the Contributions. Within six (6) months of the End Disbursement Date (as defined below), the World Bank shall furnish to the Donors a final report on the activities financed by the Trust Fund. 5.2 Any Donor may review or evaluate activities financed by the Trust Fund at any time up to six (6) months following the End Disbursement Date. The Donor and the World Bank shall agree on the scope and conduct of such review or evaluation, and the World Bank shall provide all relevant information within the limits of the World Bank's applicable policies and procedures. All associated costs, including any costs incurred by the World Bank, shall be borne by the Donor. It is understood that any such review or evaluation will not constitute a financial, compliance or other audit of the Trust Fund. 6. Disbursement: Cancellation; Refund 6.1 It is expected that the funds deposited in the Trust Fund will be fully disbursed by the World Bank by December 31, 2017 (the "End Disbursement Date"). The World Bank shall only disburse funds deposited in the Trust Fund for the purposes of this Administration Agreement (other than returns to Donors) after such date to the extent such date is changed in accordance with amendments made to the Administration Agreements of all the Donors. Following the End Disbursement Date, the World Bank shall return any remaining balance of the Trust Fund to each Donor in the Holding Currency in the manner specified in its respective Administration Agreement on a pro rata basis with regard to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by such Donor relative to the total funds deposited in the Trust Fund by all Donors, all calculated as Holding Currency amounts. 6.2 Any Donor may cancel all or part of such Donor's pro rata share, and the World Bank may cancel all or any Donors' pro rata shares, upon three (3) months' prior written notice, of any Contributions (paid and not yet paid) that are not committed pursuant to any agreements entered into between the World Bank and any consultants and/or other third parties for the purposes of this Administration Agreement, including any Grant Agreements, prior to the receipt of such notice. In the event of a cancellation, the World Bank shall return to the relevant Donor or Donors in the Holding Currency in the manner specified by each such Donor in its respective Administration Agreement the pro rata share(s) of any such uncommitted balance of the Trust Fund, in accordance with any additional terms that may be agreed between the World Bank and each such Donor. 7. Disclosure: Dispute Resolution 7.1 The World Bank shall disclose the Administration Agreements and related information on this Trust Fund in accordance with the World Bank's Policy on Access to Information. By entering into Administration Agreements, the Donors consent to such disclosure of their respective Administration Agreements and such related information. 7.2 The Donors and the World Bank shall use their best efforts to amicably settle any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to the Administration Agreements. 7
ï»¿ANNEX 3 Governance This Annex shall be applicable to and form an integral part of the Administration Agreement for the Trust Fund between the World Bank and the Donor. 1. Governance Structure The Trust Fund shall have three levels of governance with the following responsibilities and operating structure: (a) Annual consultations between the Donor and the World Bank. The Donor and the World Bank shall be responsible for leading annual consultations between the Parties on programming, existing and potential partnerships, and operation of this and other trusts funds across the World Bank. The progress and management of the Trust Fund shall be discussed during the annual consultations referred to herein, including inter alia: (i) a report from the World Bank on the progress and activities of the World Bank Group Korea Office during the preceding year; (ii) guidance from the Donor on strategic areas and staffing supported by the Trust Fund; (iii) views on future strategies and activities of the World Bank Group Korea Office; and (iv) new areas of interest and funding support from the Donor. During the third year of Trust Fund implementation, the Donor and the World Bank shall convene and analyze the experience of the previous two years of implementation, including the budget and expenditures incurred throughout such period. Based upon such consultations, the Donor and the World Bank may then consider an extension of the Trust Fund and agree on an appropriate budget thereto. (b) The Trust Fund Manager shall administer the Trust Fund with the responsibility for, inter alia: (i) reporting on the annual work program of the activities financed through the Trust Fund; (ii) monitoring the expenditures approved under the Trust Fund; (iii) monitoring and evaluating progress of Trust Fund activities, including the preparation and presentation of a Trust Fund assessment during the annual consultations referred to in the previous paragraph; and (iv) ensuring that transfers from TF No. 072055 to the present Trust Fund are carried out on a timely basis. The World Bank shall establish and maintain appropriate records and accounts of the Trust Fund activities, and ensure that all Trust Fund contributions are identified and tracked upon in accordance with the terms of the Administration Agreement and World Bank policies. (c) The World Bank Country Management Unit for China, Mongolia and Korea shall be responsible for the day-to-day management of the Trust Fund under the day-to-day direction of the Special Representative for Korea. 8
